title: Why is banning a teammate's champion allowed?
body:
Why is this allowed?? It literally says you don't want to win the game, which breaks Riot's rules in Ranked.

So far the only argument I can find is if the teammate is trolling. Do you think that banning their champion is going to stop the trolling? No!

I reckon this should be a reportable offense.

replies.body: If they're banning it because it's a contested pick like Katarina and you're last pick then they aren't doing anything wrong (though it is polite to at least acknowledge your pick). If they're banning it because they're being an ass then that *is* reportable through post game or support ticket if the lobby dodges.

It was likely the first champ off the top of their head, but you get the picture :P

You wouldn't really want to risk leaving x FoTM pick for your last pick player who is hovering it when the enemy team has priority.
Like Yaia said, Kat is just who I ban cause I hate vsing her, she's not especially contested atm. Contested picks also vary a lot by elo so *shrug*.

Lol. If you're down the bottom and one of the last ones to pick you better believe people will ban you're champ if they are a heavily contested one. Or also if no one is willing to pick it for you. Why would someone leave it open for the other team to pick first? Reportable offense please.....
The problem is people can lie on their pick intent and troll be stopping you from banning someone you really want to ban that they don't even want to play. :(
Yeah I ban Lee Sins and Yasuos if they are hovered late in the draft, just not worth the risk.

Just because a player bans a champ that a team mate has as their pick intent doesn't mean that's the reason they've banned the champ. To put it simply: correlation ≠ causation. There are several reasons to ban any given champ, even those that a team mate might have as their pick intent. One example is as Roguestoney said, any champ that is heavily contested is likely to be banned if the first/second pick on the team isn't willing to select them, whether for themselves or a team mate, in order to prevent the opposing team from getting them. Another possibility is that the person banning the champ is going with a strategy/pick that they significantly struggle with against that particular champ, and so they ban the champ to give themselves a better chance of doing well, or they might see an ally with a pick that would struggle against the champ and just ban it to give their team mate a better chance of doing well.

Fact is, there are many reasons to ban any given champ, regardless if someone has them as a pick intent, that all fall within the category of "trying to win". Just because you don't like it when it happens to you doesn't mean it's suddenly going to be against the rules, players are free to ban any champ they want to.
